text: Colore giallo leggermente torbida, schiuma media persistente, al naso prevalenza di malto e luppoli, coriandolo. Al palato agrumi, coriandolo, frutta, albicocca, crosta di pane. Corpo pieno,bevuta dolce con retrogusto amaro. Un ottimo equilibrio tra i malti di una tripel e lamaro dei luppoli di una ipa che nasconde un elevato grado alcolico.
Shared 341ml bottle. Hazy gold, white head. Aroma of citrus, herbs and white pepper. Taste is citrus, orange zest, alcohol, herbs, more white pepper.

Aroma: interesting; almost like the yeasty smell in a brewery; addition of some kind of vegetable - cant place it; Appearance: hazy golden pour with creamy white head that lingers; Taste: sour, funky, lemony with some coriander; not my favorite; Palate: medium body with long, spicy finish; Overall: can appreciate it but wouldnt want again.

Cloudy deep copper-golden with a sticky off white foamy cap. Light herbal and musty semisweet Belgian golden malts with a kiss of citrus. Full Belgian pale malty flavor with a kiss of semisweet candi sugar tones, with sage and some other herbal tones I cant put my finger on. Lightly citric and bready and full.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 Grandissima triple., Dorata con sottile schiuma bianca. Al naso quella nota di malto e. Lievito, al palato perfetta nel equilibrio tra malto e secchezza con punta amara. Corpo medio e alcol ben presente, finale appena fruttato. Grande triple.

Bottle, 341mL. Home. A golden orange clear beer with a medium white head ; medium retention ; ok lacing. Fruits + (citrus such as lime and grapefruit ; tropical fruits), herb, light resin, light caramel, sugar, alcohol. Medium round sweet, medium dry bitter warming ; light fresh episodes. Full body, light to medium oily texture ; soft carbonation ; bittersweet fruity strong finish. Overall, very good !

Clear golden body, medium white head. Aroma of ripe litchi, pineapple, other exotic fruits. Flavours of ripe litchi, caramel, exotic fruits, yeast. Medium warm fruity finish, fairly bitter and dry. Yummy

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ home. Pours a cloudy yellow liquid and an off white lasting head with good duration and nice lacing. It has typical citra notes nicely blended with tripel characteristics. Aroma is dry. Taste and Aroma of orange, lemon, white pepper, vanilla, almonds, herbs, tangerine. Crisp finish. Very nice.

Couleur jaune dorée, bonne mousse. Nez fruits jaunes sucrés, levure belge et note de houblon, bien dans le style belge .Gout fruits jaunes, levures, grains, un peu confit sucré avec note dalcool. Bon corps épais. Fin bien amere houblonnée avec des notes citronnées, levurées voir florales. Nickel!

Keg at FOB for Journee Peche. It pours a clean golden color with a large white head. Aroma is spicy and seeet initially with notes of orange peel and caramel, then it has some grassy herbal Citric hops to cut through the sweetness. Taste is also quite sweet up front with notes of alcohol, spices, candies orange peel, grass and lemon leaves. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, tasty

Une bière blonde, avec une fine carbonatation, un peu trouble, avec une carbonatation moyenne. Au nez, les levures belges sont à lhonneur avec une impression sucrée également présente, et une petite touche fruitée, que lon cherche un peu. En bouche, cest définitivement plus malté que je my attendais, avec un goût caramélisé cachant mal les 10,2%. Les levures sont plus en arrières-pensées, et le houblon est plus caché, on doit le chercher pour trouver une petite pointe damertume en fin de bouche. Au final, Dieu du Ciel aurait peut-être avantage à réduire le taux dalcool un peu pour avoir une bière peut-être un peu moins maltée, et un peu plus sur les levures et laromatique du houblon.

Blonde doré. Nez ultra houblonné. Corps riche et sucré vite rattrapé par une amertume soutenue. Fruité et parfumé. Pêche. Mangue. Abricot. Lavande. Poivre rose. Finale fruit (mangue) séché et houblonné. Excellente bière. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2017 Mooi goudblond, licht troebel bier met romige witte schuimkraag. Fris, hoppig aroma (citrus, gist, hooi). Krachtige, volmondige tripel met kruidig smaakprofiel (gist, licht harsig, kruidnagel, beetje koriander). Warme, soepele afdronk. Prima tripel.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Citrus, spices, oranges, fruit.
Body: Medium body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Citrus, spices, yeast, some alcohol, fruit.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, Nr Gent, Belgie, consumed at Mum and Keighs, Kempsey, Nr Worcester, Worcestershire, Sunday 1st January 2017 New Years Day   Pours hazy gold, with a little white filmy head. A big brute of a Triple, hoppy but sweet and with a punchy booziness throughout. At first I wasnt sure but now I like it, good mouthfeel, resiny hops.  A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov15 3.8

Hazy amber color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of yeast, rich floral, clove, & spice; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, caramel, fruit/citrus, hops, and spice; Warm finish; Nicely balanced; Very good.

Bottle from biere-import. Hazy gold to orange. Head is thin to medium and white. Medium body. Smooth body. Low to medium carbonation. Medium bitterness. Long dry finish. Aroma and flavour is orange, yeast, citrus, herby, hops, spices, alcohol.

Flaska. Något dimmig orange med ett vitt skum. Dofter av citron, nektarin, jäst och peppar. Smakinslag av apelsin, nektarin, mango, örter och honung. Värmande alkohol. Fruktig avslutning. Fyllig kropp. Väldigt bra!
@ train to Gothenburg 20161105. Bottle (341 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity, yeasty and spicy, hoppy notes, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and fruity.
@ The train on our way to All In Beer Fest 5/11-16. Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity and spicy with hops. Body is medium, the finish is dry, bitter and spicy.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a golden colour beer with a medium head. Herbs and spices with fruity and hoppy notes. Dry bitter and spicey finish

Pours cloudy dark orange with a small white head. Nose is a bit hoppy for, with floral hops, some Belgian spices, biscuit and citrus. Flavour of honey sweetness, apricots, citrus fruits, biscuit, and flowers. Finishes quite sweet and on the flowers note.

Dieu du Ciel! Herbe à Détourne. Ótima tripel com especiarias. Excelente!!! Muito boa mesmo!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kolor:  Ciemnej pomarańczy. Piwo jest mętne. 
 Piana:  Obłędna wręcz. Biała, czapowata, drobnoziarnista. Cały czas pływa po powierzchni i ani nie myśli o redukowaniu się. Po kilku dobrych minutach osuwa się po ściankach szkła pozostawiając wzorowy lacing.
Dawno nie widziałem już tak trwałych koronek. 
Klasa! 
 Zapach:  Pierwsze aromaty są dość zaskakujące jak na Tripela, ale w końcu to nie jest zwykły Tripel, a New World Tripel.
Zapachniało chmielem Citra - sporo aromatów kwiatowych, żywicznych i cytrusowych.
Pod spodem czuć brzoskwinie, morele, a dalej za nimi sporo przypraw (pieprz, lekki goździk).
Mocno pikantne i fenolowe tło. 
 Smak:  Tutaj już nie ma najmniejszych wątpliwości, że jest to Tripel Klasztorny.
Smak jest wielowarstwowy i złożony.
Silne nuty fenolowe, goździki, pieprz, może nawet subtelna kolendra. 
Zdecydowanie owocowe z akcentami brzoskwini, pomarańczy i moreli.
Dalej w kolejce ustawia się zdecydowana sugestia belgijskich drożdży.
Na szarym końcu może muśnięcie Citry z jej cytrusowym sznytem.
Perfekcyjna balans słodów, chmieli i drożdży.
Goryczka średnia, dość wyraźna. 
Finisz jest kompozycją składającą się z przyprawowych fenoli (wyraźna pieprzowa pikantność).
Średnie ciało i odpowiednia faktura.
Alkohol kompletnie nieobecny. Nie ma nawet rozgrzewajacego charakteru. Niebywałe. 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Fantastyczny Abbey Tripel z elementami India Pale Ale.
Można by rzecz, że idealne Belgian IPA. Z tym że Belgii tutaj dużo więcej, niż Ameryki, a to duży plus bo we wszystkich polskich hybrydach w tym klimacie, które piłem było zupełnie odwrotnie.
Zaczne od najważniejszej zalety - 10,2% alkoholu, a pije się piwo jak lekkie Belgian Pale Ale.
Piwo pozostawia w pamięci niesamowite wrażenia sensoryczne, nawet dla tych którzy nie przepadają za belgijskimi stylami.
Smak jest bogaty i wielowarstwowy, od belgijskich drożdży, przez przyprawowe fenole (goździki, pieprz, lekka kolendra, owoce - brzoskwinie, pomarańcze i morele, potem trochę słodów i na koniec wisienka na torcie w postaci cytrusów pochodzących od chmielu Citra.
Kompozycja pierwszorzędna. 
Browar ma u mnie ogromny procent zaufania. 
Z pewnością będę chciał przygarnąć każde kolejne napotkane ich piwo.
Tworzą piwa wprost wybitne w każdym stylu.
Polecam szczerze!

Cloudy gold color with storming multi-speed and layered activity. Thick frothy and rocky beige 3-4 finger island head, lasting around 15 minutes, with thick legs. Flavors of pineapple, mango, lemon, clove, sweet grains, honey, coriander, peppercorn, floral and herbal spices. Juicy tropical fruits sweetness with delicate grassy bitterness. Slick oily full body with prickly and zesty carbonation. Strong finish, a little dry yet the alcohol is well hidden, lingering orange and citrus hops, some grass and pine, with thick sweet malts and a floral bouquet. Delicious flavors, bold and filling, yet quite fresh. Good balance and intensity, complex, although feels more like a Belgian IPA than actual Tripel. Overall excellent quality craft.

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity spicy hoppy aroma with weak yeasty hints. Fruity malty spicy yeasty citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty citrus hoppy finish.
Couleur blond trouble. Nez fruité un peu fermé. Bouche sur les fruits exotiques, litchi. Malt, houblon. Quelque chose de laiteux. Proche dun malt belge. Pas mal et puissant.

Lovely tasty stuff. Dangerously well masked alcohol.Hazy pale golden color with a fine white head. Nice intensity in the aroma. Medium to full body and a fine carbonation level. Moderate ok acidity and a balanced sweetness. Fruity, citric, some yeast and some spices. Lovely stuff.[Bottle from Systembolaget web order in Sweden]
Klar, gyllene halm färgad, tätt lätt orange färgat skum. -4 Doft: Belgo, gräs, röda äpplen, höst luft, alkohol. Smak: Belgo, inlagd lätt jäst frukt, alkohol, växter, parfym, kryddor, APK limpa.

341ml bottle from Systembolaget. Slightly hazy golden, mid-size long-lasting white head, good lacing. Rich fruity, hoppy aroma, pineapple, fresh peaches, lemon, ripe sweet orange, honey sweet and mildly floral. Soft carbonated, full-bodied, silky mouthfeel. Sweet fruity taste, citrus, elderberry, peach, orange, honey, yeast, white pepper. Warming finish with mild floral bitterness. Well-made!

341ml bottle @ home. 
Poured near golden color with a thin white head. 
Citrusy nose, spices, apricots, creamy. 
Floral, citrusy, apricotty, very dry stuff. Excellent drinkability. Noway this is 10%.

Pale golden light haze. Citrussy, light resinous, caramelly belgy spicy nose. Pretty nice n intense. Full bodied, citrus, grapefruity, floral pale malty, some abv in flavour. Fruity, belgy tripely. Real nice. Flavourful, fruity, intense.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

330ml bottle from systembolaget. Bottled on 2016-03-15.


Clear orange colour with a big white head. Crispy, dry fruits, grapefruit, mouth drying palate, good but not so refreshing.

Aroma is really exciting, full of lemongrass, dried fruits, pineapple and yeast. Taste is really crisp and refreshing. Herbal and sweet fruity with apricots and citrus taking the lead. Slight marzipan and spice notes in the end. Theres pretty much going on in here, and this might not be your regular tripel, but I dont care - its a lot more tastier.
En ganska klassisk trippel, möjligen något fruktigare. Disig gyllengul öl med vitt skum. Doft och smak av fruktighet, jäst, marsipan och en pepprig kryddighet. I smaken tillkommer lite honungssötma.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Deep straw, quite cloudy, white head. Spicy, hoppy aroma, some yeasty notes, citrus with spruce, cloves, apricot and light caramel. Dry, medium body. Taste is slightly, grassy hoppy with apricot, spruce, resin, cloves and yeast. Just enough complexity to keep it interesting and balanced. Lovely beer.

Gul, disig med medelstort skum. Spännande doft med frukt (mango, aprikos, citrus), kryddor (bl.a. kryddpeppar) och jäst. Smaken är först fruktig med söta frukter - aprikos, mango och ananas - och kryddor och jäst, men mot slutet kommer citrustoner och en liten fin grapebeska och avslutningen är ganska torr. En välbalanserad tripel med trevliga humleinslag.

Pours hazy golden with a large frothy white head. Aromas of lemongrass, citrus, minerals, hay, herbal and floral notes. Taste is crispy herbal and floral with slight fruity notes. Too many impressions to sort out. Lots of different flavors and textures yet very well balanced and distinct. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation snd quite dry. Very good indeed. Another absolutely stellar offering from these Canadians.

Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av humle, malt, ljus torkad frukt, marsipan med toner av dill, peppar och kryddor. Stor sötma, något spretig (ångrar att jag inte lagrade denna något år), fruktig, fyllig, beska med smak av citrusskal och toner av grapefrukt. Gott!

Bouteille 341ml, bottled 2016-03-07.
Dorée sur un col épais blanc.
Arôme au nez herbacé assez plaisant sur des effluves belges niveau levure, et un côté grains malt pils. Retrouve des flagrances plaisantes de tropical tout en gardant cette consonance belge.
Palais est belge niveau levure et grains, pointe épicée, fleuri rappelant le sureau + malt pils.
Léger fruité tropical en retrait, et sucre résiduel? Fini gardant une belle note de houblonnage à cru assez marqué de Citra. Belle réussite, mais je minterroge sur la signification du nom de la bière.

341 ml bottle from Systembolaget poured in to a Trappist glass. Hazy golden amber colour with with a thin, white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, yeasts, floral hops, apricot, peaches, grasses and a hint of booze. Taste is bitter. Full body with an oily texture and a lively carbonation. Finishes long lasting dry and fruity bitter with citrus and a rich fruitiness. Excellent hopped up Tripel.

341ml Bottle - Golden with a slight haze and a white head. Lemon, gooseberries and some floral and herbal notes in the aroma. Floral, hoppy, fruity and moderately sweet taste with grapefruit, elderflower, lemon, gooseberries and grass.
Another truly outstanding beer from these guys. Herbal, spicy light and delicious.

How: bottle Appearance: cloudy golden with a medium white head. Aroma: strong spicey yeast tones, some citrus peel, ripe fruits, cranberries and herbal notes. Palate: full to medium body, medium to soft carboantion.
Refrigerated 11.5 oz. brown bottle poured into a Tappist glass. Opaque light brown with big golden highlights with medium white head. Taste is banana, spice, yeast, and some clove.

Bottle from local SB cons 2016-08-14 Göteborg, beer no 20 from this brewer.
AR: sweet citrus, line, wee spicey yeastines 
AP: clear coppery, very high frothy white head, nice curtains
F: sweet yeasty, lime zest, lemon flesh, warming feeling,

Bottle. Pours a nearly clear, golden body with a large, white top. Lovely aroma of citrus, malts and a touch of that belgian yeasty-fruityness. Flavor is light sweet with a moderate fruity / estery touch. Some hints of grass, spice / clove and pepper. This is a very good tripel and quite drinkable despite the high abv. The mouthfeel is creamy and it has a lively co2 level. Ends on a dry and somewhat bitter note.

Flaska från SB. Gyllengul med tjockt skum. Doft av mandarin, dill, örter och marsipan. Kryddig och pepprig, lite spritig, apelsin/mandarin, dill, lång besk eftersmak. Intressesand och elegant modern crossover trippel men också lite tröttsam i längden och väl svår.

Bottle from systembolaget Sweden. Small but lasting white head. Opaque golden color. Really nice wood and Belgian phenolic aroma with some chemical plastic aroma. Intense phenolic taste and a bit harsh / tart taste. No sweetness and malty with a firm body and a lingering bitterness.

Pours dark golden with a white head. 
Aroma; Citrus, pineapple, peach, blood orange, Belgo yeast, hay, bread, earth and spicy notes with a sting of alchohol in the end.
Taste; Citrus, blood orange, peach, pineapple, Belgo yeast, bread, earth and spicy notes.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2016 Draft at Khyber Pass. Very hazy dark gold pour with some frothy white lace on top that left a lasting spray of lace. Complex mix. Dark tropical earthy flavors. Blood orange pineapple. Walnuts. Purple passionfruit. Charred potpourri. Peach pits. Pinecones. Black plums. Squash. Mango cashews. Peppercorns. Spicy, bitter and brash - but smooth concidering the ABV. Certainly worthwhile but not quite as extraordinary as others seem to find it.
Bottle from SB. Cloudy golden with a medium white head. Fruity and spicy tones. Fruit, spices, malt and hops. Full body with a long fruity / malty finish.

Pours hazy golden with medium high white head
Aromas of fenols, blood oranges, hay, herbal bread, citrus
Taste has notes of blood oranges, orange peel, hay, fenols, bready maltyness, caramel, alcohol

Aroma is sweet and lightly tart, with tangerine, apricot, citrus peel, bubblegum, leafy hops, some herbal phenolics and light spice, wheat cracker. Flavour is semi-sweet at first and some citrusy acidity for balance, with dried apricots, preserved peach, orange and grapefruit juice, orange peel, light bubblegum esters, herbal hops, white pepper, white bread. Finish is quite dry with some warming alcohol, citrus pith and herbal bitterness, some peppery spice too. Aftertaste slightly astringent and a bit boozy. Medium-full body with soft creamy carbonation. Perhaps the hops are a touch faded but it still comes across as a fruity new world-influenced tripel, with hoppy notes merging well with those from the yeast.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Hazy golden/orange with a medium head. 
Sweetish, peppery aroma. 
Slightly alcoholic. 
Sweet oranges, overripe plums and spicies in the flavour.

Bottle from Systembolaget.

Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma of orange, light spices and some malt. Similar taste. The body was medium and the finish on the dry side. A pleasant one.

341ml bottle.
Deep straw, quite cloudy, white head.
Spicy, hoppy aroma, phenolic yeast notes, citrus, spruce, cloves, apricot, light caramel.
Dry, medium bodied, mid to high bitterness, balanced CO2.
Spicy, citrusy, hoppy taste, apricot, spruce, cloves, phenols, yeast.
Very complex, well balanced, really good! (2016-07-29)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2016 Flaska systembolaget. Disig gulorange kulör. Doft av aprikos, passionsfrukt, gröna äpplen, blommor och jäst. Örtig smak med aprikos, citrus och färskt hö. Aningen söt smak med lätt efterbeska. Frisk och lite spritig.

Bottle in wine glass. Now this is a tripel to my liking! What an absolutely amazing brew. Pours wonderful in a light orange have with a perfect finger thick head. Aroma is like a sack of fruits in the face that follows on the palate with great adds of hops and perfect viscosity. Thanks!

Bottle @home. Pours hazy yellow with lacy white head. Nice and fresh aroma, like a classic belgium beer with more hops and citrus. The taste reflects the aroma. Presence of yeast and refreshing taste of citrus and hops. Good biterness in the finish. Very good stuff.

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Cloudy pale golden, small head. Peppery nose with tangerine, dill and marzipan. Dryish with medium body and crisp, rounded mouthfeel. Peppery and elegant, citrus and marzipan. Long bitter finish. Another excellent crossover between North American and European brewing styles from Dieu du Ciel!
@ Basunen 16-7-23: Rätt ok med toner av cirtus, frsmföralt apelsin. Trevlig fyllighet med en liten hetta i eftersmaken.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours hazy apricot with a big frothy fluffy goldenish white head that slowly dissipates while leaving lots of thick sticky trace on the glass. Smell is fruity and tiny spicy with crackers, white bread, baked pears, canned peaches, tangerines, grapefruit juice, moist grass, dry soil, white pepper corns, orange zest and hints of alcohol. Taste is slightly sweet, bitter, fruity and spicy. Mouthfeel is round, slightly astringent, slightly boozy and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with grapefruit, yellow tropical fruits, white pepper corns and alcohol. Bottled in March and I suspect this would have been even better back then. That aside the hops still provide plenty of fruit. Bit bitter and boozy perhaps but fighting off the last of a summer cold this was perfect to awaken your senses. Cool blend between triple and IIPA. Reminds me a lot of that Chouffe beer...

Bottle. Clear golden, generous big white frothy head, dissipates slowly leaving lots of lacings. Aroma is very citrusy floral, slight yeast note, slight sweet malty note, slight alcohol. Maybe a bit too new world hoppy for a tripel, but a nice aroma anyway. Taste is very balanced, citrus and bread, slight peppery note, creamy maltiness before finishing in a long warming, slightly bitter, finish. Medium to big body, low carbo, creamy texture. Perhaps not a classic tripel in my book, but very interesting and well made on its own (it even says New World Triple on the label so I guess they accomplished what they set out do do).

Pale golden color, medium white head. Slight haze. Lemon lollipop, citrus, sugar, yeast and cough drop aromas. Taste is citrus, lemon cough drop. Citrus and yeast during the finish. Feels weird tasting something I ever only taste while Im having a cold, so not very pleasant.

Citrus, yeast, spices but also a strong hoppy profile with orange and tropical fruits, orange with a good white and creamy head quite persistant, medium body, medium/high carbonation, citrus like a belgian tripel, not too bitter...this old man does not fear any comparison.
330ml bottle at Jameys. Pours a slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma and taste bring lots of bakery spices, fruity sweetness, flowers, hops. Very good beer.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2016 Bue à la pression. Belle couleur orangée, mousse qui fait le job, nez au taquet sur la pêche avec une pointe dacidité. En bouche cest rond comme un mamelon de Laetitia Casta, notes doranges caramélisées tout en douceur. Une tuerie, thats all folks !

Bottle at home and draft at the brewpub. Slightly hazy golden body, medium white dense head with excellent retention and plenty of lacing. Aroma of yeast, orange candies, herbs, lemons, a touch of leather, peach jam. Taste of yeast, herbs, grapefruit zest, oranges, peaches, mango. A bit boozy, but still a fantastic blend of a tripel and IPA.

Tap at Bar Volo. Listed as 9.0%. Almost clear orange with off-white head. Really nice citric fruity aroma of orange and peach, jam and marmalade. Flavours similar - tastes jammy sweet with citric-grassy-leafy-herbal hints. Good thin carbonation, medium plus body. The finish is perhaps a bit too thin with some booze shining through. Otherwise excellent, bloody excellent!
Small bottle from Bottle Jockey in Burnaby. A pale amber beer with moderate white head and faint nose. Light, refreshing, fruity, hoppy. Nice. 3.9
bottled on2016/2/4 oro carico velata torbida buona schiuma piuttosto persistente interessante naso agrumato fruttato filo spezia etilico controllata buona secchezza piacevole amaro
(tap) hazy, bright orange colour with a small white head; aroma of jam, sweetness; intense, balanced flavour with a long, medium bitter finish; well hidden alcohol

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2016 Une superbe triple !Nez hyper frais, houblonné, très floral, agrumes. Un fond d?alcool et de levures.Bouche très fraîche : attaque relativement éthylique et léger maltage. Assez fruitée avec des petites notes pêche, un peu de levures, finale houblonnée, très agrumes et de nouveau assez éthylique. Longueur assez herbale.

Biere de couleur jaune paille, tres peu de mousse et bulle pour une triple/ au nez fruit de la passion/ en bouche cest agrumes avec une amertume douce suivit dune finale alcool qui fait ressentir le 10.2%

Great display of citra in an all too quaffable Tripel. Pours a hazy, yeasty peach with small white head. Aroma is estery, grapefruit, melon, and candy. Tastes of grapefruit, melon, candy, citrus, and gum. Has a big warmth that is chewy and dry, also very filling.

Servie dune bouteille à une tulipe. La bière est orangée et trouble, avec un très faible col. Au nez, wow. Ce que jaime des IPA américaines : fruits tropicaux et agrumes (merci Citra!), et ce que jaime des belges : quelque chose dépicé et de réconfortant. En bouche, toute la rondeur, la présence et la chaleur dune triple, avec une pointe de fruits tropicaux qui vient bercer le tout. La finale est chaude et bien longue. Classique.

Bottle. Pours cloudy with lots of suspended sediment, a small, white, frothy head that leaves some lacing. Aroma of pepper, sweet grass, bubblegum and sweet tropical fruits. Tastes of coriander, clove, alcohol, caramel, medium body, medium bitterness, sticky mouthfeel offset by bitterness, average carbo, and a very long bitter finish.

Rating datant du 6 mars 2016. Bouteille de 341ml de la batch du 2 février 2016. La combinaison parfaite entre une Tripel belge et une IPA américaine aux fruits tropicaux. Sajoute à la longue liste des classiques de Dieu du Ciel.

Transparent golden orange hue with a minimally sized white head. Pleasant aroma containing notes of citrus, caramel, flora, and tropical fruit. Amazing and complex flavour that commences with caramel, vanilla, malt and biscuits which promptly evolves into an ipa like citrus, floral, and hoppy mix. Wonderful.
Pours a golden amber with fizzy head. Aromas of fruit and hella booze. Flavors of spicy hops, yeast, and some smooth boozy notes on the finish.

Aroma: banana, molasses, grain, light barnyard. Appearance: slightly hazy, small, creamy, white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: sweets continue, very strong, overripe fruit, caramel, then bitters come up, dry finish. Overall: nice Tripel, great aroma and palate. Pint at Rattle n Hum 33rd, Manhattan.
Creamy orange with sediment. Pungent overripe citrus nose. Bitter orange peels on the tongue. Creamy on the tongue and lingers. A bit disappointing for DdC.

Hazy golden liquid with a taller light beige head. Sweet aromas with orange blossom honey, stewed currants, light candi and marzipan. Thick oily feel. A bit too lifeless. Flavors of stewed ripe to over-ripe fruit. Mild burn on the tongue. Pineapple, mango, bits of citric acid. Peppery alcohol in the linger. A beer that promises much, but delivers some extremes that throw things off. 9/14

Dorée/orangée, trouble, avec une petite mousse crème qui laisse de la dentelle. Nez houblonné dagrumes, dananas, de miel, de céréales et de levure belge. Goût de houblons, dagrumes, fruité, sucré/mielleux et un peu de poivre. En bouche, cest doux, onctueux et une amertume qui se laisse encore sentir après la finale.

Aromas of hops, hazy golden color. Floral, fruity taste, with some hops mixed in. Light in the mouth. Great mix. Body could have been a bit heavier for an even better result.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Dégustée en accompagnement dune salade descarole à la pancetta. Ça fait plusieurs années que je bois cette bière à sa sortie et je choisis ce millésime pour mon commentaire car ça fait une paie que la brasserie nen a pas sorti un semblable! Un ballon ensoleillé rempli de ce liquide plein de chaleur, tel un gros soleil! Une mousse riche, un corps puissant. Des arômes fruités, puissants, intelligents. Mes narines sont envahies par des arômes dorange, de poire et dananas. Un malt doux et de solides houblons prennent part à cette fête dune complexité étonnante! En bouche le liquide propose un corps chargé et élégant. Une bière qui ne renie pas ses racines Belges. Tout y est avec en prime un puissant houblonnage qui est ni très amer, ni tape à loeil. Le fruit est abondant sans être abusif, la levure Belge est présente sans être agrémentée dun sucre résiduel trop lourd et lassant. Une longue finale où lalcool est présent (à 10,2% on le pardonne) sans être déplaisant. Une très belle réussite! Merci Dieu Du Ciel! pour cet excellent produit!
Les arômes de houblon sont invitants \\\ En bouche, il y a de lagrume, du miel et un peu de poivre /// je me suis tanné avant la fin de la bouteille même si jaimais ça au début

En bouteille. Couleur jaune, opaque avec bcp de particules en suspension. Légère mousse. Pamplemousse, miel, floral, sèche. Alcool peu perceptible. Palais onctueux avec amertume résiduel élevé. Très solide.

Nez de pelure dorange, citron, malté avec une mousse très légère. Aux yeux, cest orangé/pale avec de minuscules particules de lies qui nagent dans le verre. Au goût citronné de houblon avec une dérive de poivre doux que jaime bien, de miel et une touche malté soutenu! Une finale Sèche et floral!

Tap at Gollem. Pours clear blonde, ok white head. Smell is citrus forward , some malts. Taste is sweet - malty, with a Nice citrahoppy aroma. Mild, but present bitterness, crispy malts . some ipa-yeast-factors. Really good !
Pours a large frothy white head atop a sediment Amber body. Nose of lemon zest. Very flavourful - like La Fin du Monde with a peachy, nail polish and orange. Delicious.
Bottle at home 2 weeks ago. The beer was good, the night was good. What more can I say.

Pours a hazy, golden amber. Thin, foamy white head, good lacing. Aroma is faintly floral. Taste is rich, malty, with caramel and underlying floral notes. Full bodied, oily mouthfeel, nearly flat carbonation. Finished with a lingering bitterness. Very rich, but well balanced beer.

341ml bottle from Marche Jovi in Gatineau, Quebec. Hazy golden orange in colour with a thin but long lasting white head, excellent lacing. The aroma is of grapefruits and oranges, tropical, some underlying malts. The flavour is very hoppy, lots of grapefruits, tropical fruits, light alcohol, yeasty. Bitter and hoppy mouthfeel, medium body, high carbonation. Finishes very long with loads of grapefruit hops and a bit of alcohol. Oh my fucking god. This is the shit. Easily my new favorite beer of the year (2012). Fuck this is good.

A jól bevált kanadai főzde top-kategóriás (legalábbis amennyiben a tripel műfaján belül szemlélődünk) főzete pilsner-szerű külalakkal van felruházva; átlátszó, aranysárga színű, kristálytiszta testén hófehér, tömött és krémes habkorona telepszik meg, az élesztős üledéktől csak az utolsó kortyok kitöltésekor válik opálossá az ital. Lehengerlő illatokkal indít, citrusos, grapefruitos, vadvirágos, mályvacukros, élesztős aromák törnek elő, meglehetősen pontos, éles jelleggel. Könnyed karakterű teste ízjegyekkel bőségesen megpakolt, vibráló, izgalmas, de semmi esetre sem túlzsúfolt. Mézzel megkent malátás alapra marcipános élesztős váz épül, melyet elegáns vonalú, virágos komlók erőteljes tartalommal töltenek meg. A szerkezet a hőmérséklet emelkedésével sem eszik szét, stabilan kapaszkodnak egymásba a komponensek, az alkohol lába pedig még véletlenül sem lóg ki, így lényegében minden egyes kortytól ugyanazt kapjuk - azok egy módfelett kellemes főzet benyomását keltik.

341 ml bottle. Bottled on 03/15. Thanks to Timo A!
Clear golden color with a tiny white head.
Super balanced sweet and strong citrusy and yoghurty hoppy aroma with some alcohol notes in a great aroma. Wow! 
The flavor is sweet hops, fruitiness, tropical fruits, alcohol warmth and general greatness. Amazing brew! Wow I say!

Du pure jus de citra, puissante en arôme et très longue, le tout soutenu par un fort degré dalcool tout en restant équilibrée. Superbe.

Bottle, bought @Saveur Bière. Pours clear golden with a small, creamy white head. Aroma has light milky notes, resin, peach, malts, vinious. Low carbonation, fine dry and very creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good crisp malts, balanced viniousness, floral, light milky, serious bitterness, resin. Very elegant and extremely well composed.

Japprend des choses.Le citra a un goût de savonette mais aussi de mangue.Très frais et fruitée (cette bière).Le houblonnage aromatique est bien présent.Soutenu par un corps, discret mais présent.Ca ressemble à une très bonne triple, discrête, forte mais efficace : dans le genre.

What an interesting concept. But how can it work, citrus hops with fruity Belgian esters? Well, apparently it can! Some real alcohol heat too, but with the quality ingredients it works well. (Bottle from Saveur Bière)

Bottle shared by Dr Silverworm. Poured clear golden color with an average to large frothy white head that lasted with excellent lacing. Complex citrus and sour yeast aroma. Medium to abundant body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy bittersweet & sour flavor with a medium to heavy sour & sweet finish of moderate to long duration with a small alcohol bite. This is a solid beer.
A cloudy yellow pour with aromas of honey, light citrus, some sweetness, and a touch of wheat husk. Flavors matched the aromas abv hidden well, but decent amount of honey and citrus comes through.
Picked up in Panama City. This was unexpectedly good. Honey and sweet citrus fruits, rich caramel maltiness really hold the booze in check. some tropical, just the warmth of the booze is noticeable.

Robe dorée, mince coller de mousse. Au nez, explosion dagrumes et de fruits tropicaux, accompagné darômes herbacés. Celles-ci se retrouvent également en bouche, en plus dune agréable effervescence. Aussi bonne que dans mes souvenir, cest une bière dété par excellence.

A murky, yellow beer with a medium and blond head. Great aroma, tropical fruits, spices, fruits from the yeast. Taste has fruits, also tropical fruits, spices, some warming alcohol. Medium bodied, nice carbonation. The great beer, the hops gives added value.

11.2 oz bottle shared by DrSilverworm. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a medium plus sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have a bunchof ccitrus, orange, lemon, some zest, spicy, sweet, honey, some zip to the finish, decent take on a style I dont always enjoy.

341 ml bottle. Straw gold pour, few fingers of semi dense white foamy head. Aroma of yeast, some tropical fruit and actually a decent amount of pine hops. Taste starts off slightly sweet but leads into a decently bitter finish. Very nice, alcohol does not interfere at all.

341 ml bottle. Bottled on 03/2015.
Pours clear golden color with a large white head. Kind of Saison-y spicy aroma with herbs and lots of yeast, some lemon as well as some earthy notes. Lemon flavor, which is surprisingly sweet also, lots of spices, yeasty and slightly hoppy. Very quaffable, maybe not the most refreshing of Tripels but quite crisp summery brew still. Alcohol is not at play at all here. Very nice.
4325

Draught (10.2%) @ Lambic Foeder. Rated on 25.06.2015
Aroma has sweetish apricot tones, some soapiness and fruit candy. Flavour has toasted sugar, sweet apricot and some alcohol. Rich and nice tripel, one of the best outside Belgium.
Pours golden with an inch of white head. Aroma of spruce, citrus, iced tea. Tastes of chocolate, alcohol, resin, and cherries. Oily mouthfeel. Lingering boozy aftertaste.

Bottle 2014, pours pretty enough . They say Tripel but I say a Belgian styled IPA. I have even let this age a tad, while not all that bitter the tropical, dank, pine and oniony notes are still quite prevalent. One and done.
Dark golden near orange. Fruity citra aroma. Taste was actually surprising, a ton of orange citrus with a belgian yeast and it totally works, fruity orange juice with yeasty goodness.

341 ml bottle. Pours a hazy amber with moderate head that settles quickly. Aromas of mashed fruit and citrus. Flavors of pine, spruce, lemons. mangos and biscuity malts. Nice but not a Tripel - its an IIPA.
Bottle at brewdog Edinburgh. Pours hazy peach, nose is herbal, sweet toffee, taste is herbal, sweet, fruity.
Bottle at brewdog... Golden amber... Soft floral fruit.. Soft orange... Dry zezty fruits.. Zezty orange.. Soft zezty salty fruits

Good sweet Jesus I love these guys. Pour is cloudy pale orange with a small creamy white cap. Nose is a tantalizing mix of dank, resinous, citrus and tropical fruit hops, with sweet, fruity, sugary malt, bready Belgian yeast and booze. In a nutshell this a really solid tripel with a shit ton of (remarkably complementary) Citra hops. Finish is boozy and bitter, lingering citrus and alcohol warmth. This stuff just works so bloody well. God of the sky indeed.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2015 Dune belle jaune légèrement voilée, un arôme fruité avec les levures belges et agrumes (une bonne présence des houblons [citra?]). En bouche il y a les mêmes saveurs, un peu du sucre et du levure belge. Il nest pas aussi fruité que les triples belges, mais laddition de plus dhoublon a très, très bien marcher et las donné bien plus dagrumes et las rendu très unique.

Bouteille de 341ml au Marché des Brasseurs (brassin 03/15). Robe jaune/orangée, légèrement trouble surmontée dune mince mousse blanche et fuyante laissant peu de dentelle sur le verre. Nez dagrumes, dherbes terreux sur de légères notes de sucre. En bouche, cest le pamplemousse jaune qui attaque en premier (ya des tonnes de Citra là dedans!!). Cest suivi de notes de fruit tropicaux et de sucre, le tout tellement bien balancé quon ressent très peu lalcool qui titre pourtant à 10,2%. Une autre réussite de Dieu du Ciel!.

Dune belle couleur Gold ambrée elle produit un léger col qui ne persistera pas bien longtemps. Au Pif elle apporte un parfum très agréable de sucre et de citrus. Au gout cest un  beau mélange de levure belge, caramel & pamplemousse. Cette belle aventure se termine, en finale, sur un beau mélange damertume et de sucre. Ostie qucest bon! :)

Dune belle robe jaune légèrement voilée, lHerbe à détourne nous offre dès quon décapsule la bouteille, un nez explosant de saveurs fruitées/amères ( Mangue , pamplemousse , ananas , cantaloup et également fruit de la passion) dus au houblon utilisé ( CITRA ) le tout se réchauffant par une chaleur dalcool très agréable !!! La bouche nous propose exactement les mêmes saveurs pour être ensuite chevauché par une amertume soutenu par un bon côté épicé dus à la divine levure Belge ! PROOST Dieu Du Ciel meilleur brasserie du canada sans hésitation !!!!

UPDATED: APR 15, 2015 Robe jaune-orangée légèrement trouble. Quelques particules se tiennent au fond du verre. Dentelle épaisse et collante. Au nez, le houblon citra est dominant et facilement perceptible. Orange, pamplemousse, pêche, fruit de la passion, ananas. Lalcool et les levures épicées se démarquent également. En bouche, le houblon prend rapidement place et arrose le palais de saveurs fruitées. Encore une fois, lorange et le pamplemousse sont mis au premier plan. Les levures se présentent ensuite et ajoute une touche juste assez épicée pour nous rappeler que nous avons affaire à une tripel. Le goût est explosif, le citra saccroche aux papilles jusquà la toute fin. Celui-ci permet aussi de masquer le haut taux dalcool qui est bien entendu présent, mais relegué au second plan. La finale est longue, douce, amère à point et fruité. Un véritable tour de force de DDC que jattend avec impatience année après année.#Version 2014 dégustée après 1 an. Définitivement plus la même bière. Fallait sy attendre, ne subsistent du Citra que dinfimes traces. Le goût malté et terreux a pris plus de terrain. Lexpérience a été tentée mais ne se reproduira plus.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2015 Bottle from Halles St-Jean. Aroma: citrus, mangos, peaches, passion fruit. App: nice hazy peach color, small white head. Some lacing. Taste and Palate: lots of fruits in mouth, medium sweetness, light long bitter and alcohol warming finish. Overall: Pretty good! Enjoyed a lot the fruity aroma and the mouthfeel. Bought a 4-pack and will probably buy another one soon. So yummy and refreshing.

Small head, but excellent webby lace. Cloudy orange-amber color.

Relatively dry with a distinct floral hop smell. Well-balanced and very attractive.

I note plum with a subtle sweetness. Theres the slightest of soft sour, citrus touch. The swallow and finish are of sweetened grapefruit. Well-balanced and easy to drink. The body is rich but the carbonation high. I would not guess this to be a Tripel, but all of the elements are present. It is far more balanced with a higher level of hop than I expected.
Excellent tripel with a distinctly citra nose and profile that still tastes like a Tripel rather than a hoppy IPA with some ambiguous Belgian yeast.
On tap. Pours hazy light golden with moderate frothy white head. Aroma of spices, cirtus (hops). Taste is more of the same and a bit of sweetness balancing the biterness. Great.

Bottle from Table and Vine. Orange caramel with flat head. Nice peppery floral aroma with citrus and herbal hints and some creamsicle. Sweet ripe orange bready malts with herbal and citrus bitterness and some pepper in the finish. Medium body that just kind of sits there. Texture is slightly off, not soft, not fine. I wonder if this is old. Anyhow very good. In the top 1% of tripels? No.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2016 Style: triple
Ibu: -
DeScription: biere de couleur jaune paille, tres peu de mousse et bulle pour une triple/ au nez fruit de la passion/ en bouche cest agrumes avec une amertume douce suivit dune finale alcool qui fait ressentir le 10.2%

Pours a hazy golden amber topped by a finger of off-white head showing nice retention and some chunky lacing. The nose is herbal, spicy, lemony and earthy all at once. A lot more spice than Im used to in a tripel. The taste is a combination of light bready malts paired with aromatic herbal and citrusy hops, and earthy yeasts. Feels round and heavy with a strong herbal finish fading slowly. An original take on the Tripel style but it might come out to herbal for some. Cheers!

Lightly clouded golden-amber with 1cm of off-white head, medium-fine coarseness that fades fairly slowly. Aroma is orange, lemon, some leaf and pine, touch of fruit sweetness and grain. Body is medium-to-meidum-heavy, syrupy/ a bit watery-oily. Moderate carbonation, soft/soapy feel, only light burn. Flavor is leafy bitterness, soapy, a touch medicinal, light raw sugar, touch of candy, bitter finish with moderate linger. An interesting tripel, leaning heavily towards hops, specifically bittering hops, at least in the aroma. I think this is a detractor in the flavor. Also much more heavy body than is typical for the style. Too bitter.

2014 bottle. A slightly hazy golden copper color with a very sticky off-white head. Aroma is sweet orange, malt, straw and a touch of lemon. Taste is an immediate commingling of sweet malt and orange with some mango and lemon. Gives way to a nice straw taste with some peppery spice. Well carbonated medium mouthfeel. Strange but good brew, kind of like an IPA meets a tripel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours darker gold, big white head, good retention/lace. Aroma of ester, yeast, citrus/floral hop, bread. Taste is lightly bitter, yeasty, citrus, lightly tropical, sweet, bread. Palate is slick, warming, lightly bitter and sweet finish.

this brewery never fails another solid effort l. Poured a hazy yellow color with a small sized white head. Aromas of citrus, pine, yeast, and fruity. Tastes of citrus, fruits, spices, pine, and yeast. Nice hoppy finish. Overall alcohol well hidden.

Bottle.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, off-white, mostly lasting.
Body is medium amber.

Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain, corn syrup), moderately hoppy (grapefruit, orange, apricot), with notes of cotton candy / bubble gum, alcohol, grains of paradise, clove, reeds/grass.

Flavor is heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.

Medium to full body, syrupy texture, lively/soft carbonation, moderately to heavily alcoholic.

Objectively poor...very candy-ish/artificial sort of aroma, overly boozy, overly syrupy sweet. Hard to enjoy.

Pours murky copper / orange with an off-white head. The aroma has tropical / tangerine hoppiness, light banana, rich malt, abbey yeast smoothness and a bit of bread. It has a full slick body with lots of soft carbonation. The flavor begins with lots of tangerine hoppiness, other fruity aspects, malt seems quite rich, but the hops hide that aspect pretty well and there is some pine and spice notes. The finish has smooth citrus, alcohol heat and some wintergreen.

BOTTLE. Cloudy orange with a solid white head. Honey and lemon on the nose. Got sweet honey up front with a lemon, orange & citrus hit at the back end. Got a wheat beer vibe, but very nice/heavy.
Sourced Cellarbrations Capel

From 341 ml bottle in tulip. Pours a murky yellow-orange with medium white head. Lots of tropical fruits in the nose. Mango, passion fruit, and peach. Some grassy notes too. In the mouth its a fight between the esther notes, the warming alcohol, and the tropical fruit flavors. A light bitterness is also perceptible. String citrus flavors accompany the passion fruit and mango notes. Good but heavy beer!

Bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs; thanks DuffMan). Looks good; a somewhat hazy dark apricot with foamy eggshell head. Smells solid; Belgian yeast and a nice Citra presence with a well-balanced malt/hop backbone that is somewhere between bittersweet and semi-sweet. Tastes like it smells with a nice, smooth mouthfeel that doesnt drink like its 10%. The Citra really counterbalances what to me is an excessive sweetness in most Tripels. Dry for the style as well (which I enjoy). A pleasantly surprising example of a style that I rarely enjoy.
Draft. Hazy golden amber color. Aroma of herbal straw and lemon. Taste is herbs and hay.

Au risque de me faire crucifier, je vais lavouer je ne lai pas aimé. Je suis assez traditionaliste au point de vue de mes styles de bières. Je ne suis pas un fan des bières où lon rajoute quelconque ingrédients pour en modifier le style. Je sais que je semble être lun des seuls à ne pas laimer, mais pour moi, ce nest pas une triple. Le houblon citra domine complètement la bière et elle ne laisse aucune place à la levure, ni au sucre. Cest amer comme une IPA, cest même plus houblonné que la IPA que jai bu la veille. Je sais quil y a un grand public pour cette expérimentation de style, public dont je ne fais définitivement pas partie.

Bottle from State Line. Pours hazy dark straw with off-white clingy head. Nose was complex. with funky yeasty malt, hops, tropical citrus. Tasted smooth, with up front yeasty malt, then hops and tangerine and pineapple, and some peppery and floral finishing notes. This one was stellar.

Murky orange-gold with no real head, bubbling like an oddly coloured soft drink. Smells a lot better than it looks - pineapple, orange, mango, spice. Tastes even better than it smells - orange, pineapple, a little alcohol warmth but not much, slightly spicy, caramel, and good long bitterness. Fantastic beer - would love to re-rate another one to see if there is any difference in the pour

Serious fresh grapefruit nose translates directly into the taste profile. The grapefruit/citrus Citra pop is accompanied by bready, sweet malt and alcohol warmth. The medium/high carbonation adds punch to the brew and the full body of this triple holds it all together. Another bulls eye for Dieu du Ciel
Aroma of tasty, tasty hops. Tastes a bit like a triple but more like an IPA. Really good. Nice malts and really bright, fresh, citrusy hops. Yum!
Amer avec une touche dagrume, non filtré avec un look flou. Très bonne odeur fraîche et un texture presque mieleuse

Draft at ChurchKey thanks to Donnie (and then I suppose Bartender Eric)! Thanks! Poured a dark golden brown color with a small off-white head. Aroma was nice citrus notes - some grapefruit and lime. Notes of sweet malts. Flavor was caramel character, with some grapefruit. Alcohol is there, but its pretty smooth for over 10%.

Pours a hazy yellow orange with a fat finger of fluffy white head, gradually compacting to a thin cap, and moderate spotty lacing. Nose is sweet citrus and pineapple, with a little clove and earthiness. Taste is similar, pineapple and mango, with an orange peel bitter finish. Mouth feel is medium- to full-bodied, creamy, with moderate to low carbonation.

Oh yeah, thats Citra hops, all right! This reminds me of Brewsters Brewmaster Cask Citra Summer Ale, for obvious reasons, but with much more depth of flavour. I do like a good tripel, and this is a really good tripel - and deadly dangerous: the ABV is surprisingly well-hidden, showing only as a gentle warming towards the end of the glass.

Pours a hazy golden colour with a foamy off-white head, decent retention and some bubbly lace. You can definitely smell the Citra hops giving out some sweetness (oranges) and mild grapefruit zest. This creates a nice mild bitterness, well-blended the alcohol and the sweetness of the tropical fruits. Mango lingers in the aftertaste. This brew is an amazing twist on the Tripel style.

Pours golden with a huge white head. Aroma: straw, herbs, grass, slightly floral. Taste: bready maltiness, lemon, orange, ginger. Medium body, creamy, moderately sweet with a spicy bitter in the finish. Nice smooth tripel, that could use a bit more depth

Pours a clear gold with a white head and lacing. It has a great aroma of herbs and citrus hops and a bit of yeast. The flavor is mild citrus with a light malt backbone and a malty, bready finish over a medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2014 Point important de cette évaluation, je n?apprécie guère les IPA. C?est une bière qu?on m?a offerte et je les déguster en entier. Alors quoi dire d?autre qu?elle est houblonnée à souhait, on le sait des les premiers arômes. Donc, si vous aimer les IPA, nul doute qu?elle sera vous plaire.

Liquide légèrement embrouillé dune couleur tirant sur le doré. Effervescence modérée. Effluves de levure belge ainsi que de pamplemousse, dananas et je dirais de fruits de la passion. Bière dune différence que jadore!

Aroma is a wonderful combination of citrus and pineapple ester notes. Very fresh. Taste is a sweet maltiness that is quickly consumed by the bitterness of the heavy hop additions. The bitterness reveals clove and earthiness on the tip. The high abv us surprisingly smooth. Appearance is a clear gold with a thin head that retains well.

Robe blonde orangé voilée avec élégance. Un arôme puissant de fraicheur citronné qui ne peut laisser indifférent. Au goût il y a un bonne équilibre entre le sucré, lamer et lacide dans une texture de grand cru. Une finale de longueur moyenne avec une petite amertume de houblon très abordable. Une bière rafraichissante, excellent choix pour faire découvrir le style triple et la puissance du houblon à des néophytes. Et attentien, elle est traître avec ces 10.2% dalcool!

341ml bottle. Cloudy deep orange with a frothy white head. Flavors are pineapple, orange, lemon, mango, honey, dough and alcohol with floral and spicy notes. Full body, moderate carbonation, creamy texture. Warm and fruity finish.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2016 Un de mes produits préférés de 2012, que je navais pas eu la chance de dénicher depuis ;-( Toujours aussi excellente mais moins complexe quà mon souvenir... 7/4/8/4/15=3.8/5.0

Un de mes coups de coeur de lannée dernière est enfin de retour et cest toujours aussi délectable. Une robe orangée assez trouble laisse transparaître quelques fines bulles qui forment une mousse onctueuse et persistante. Au nez, ça sent fortement les ananas gracieuseté du houblon Citra. Une pointe épicée fait également frémir les narines. En bouche, force est dadmettre que lHerbe à Détourne porte très bien son nom puisque des notes herbacées sont en avant-plan. Le côté épicé vient sen mêler en finale pour adoucir lamertume généralement associé au houblon Citra. Le taux dalcool élevé à 10.2% ny paraît pas du tout, ce qui procure à cette bière une buvabilité infinie.

The beer pours a deep and oranging yellow, with a head of medium sized bubbles that eventually fades to a scrim. In body the beer is opaque and hazy with no sight of the other side of the glass. The beer leaves a light lacing of droopy bubbles on the glass, and a slick set of alcoholic legs. On the nose, the beer smells like a bristling DIPA. Huge, popping citrus and pine gushes over the nose with light hints of sticky, hot alcohol and a little bit of catty scents. Grapefruit pith and pine sap really stick on the nose from this beer, but I only get a light touch of pineapple funk from the Belgian yeast. On the tongue, the beer tastes sweet and then drying and bitter with big, hot alcohol which is nicely cushioned by the other flavors. Citric acidity plays in alongside the booze, and provides a nice wetting on the tongue. The balance of this beer is a little boozy sweet, but the hop bitters do pull the beer together nicely. In the mouth the beer feels on the plus side of medium in body with a slightly oily mouthfeel. Carbonation is a little chewy, but bites at the start of the taste. The mouth is left sticky with a bitter, resin feeling and a dryness on the back of the tongue. In flavor, the beer begins as sweet citric grapefruit and pine resin, this unfolds into slightly cloying alcohol, spicy hops and some nice finishing bitters. Slight clove notes linger in the finish and aftertaste, reminding me that this is an American Tripel, and not a DIPA, but overall this beer is a nice blend of booze and bitters. The tripel character really comes out in the mouthfeel of this beer, but lacks a little in flavor, which isnt horrible. I do wish the booziness was turned a little down and that I could get some banana/clove/Trappist funk and other nice phenolic notes. The phenols in this beer are gentle beneath the bitters and alcohol, but as the beer warms they do come out a bit and add a nice spice to the beer. This is a great boozy sipper that will feed your bitter-beer desires.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2014 Bière jaune orangée dorée, bien voilée avec quelques particules visibles et comme un brouillard en son sein, effervescence moyenne-bonne, large col blanc, très dense, mousseux, rocailleux, qui se réduit tranquillement en formant une riche dentelle sur les parois du verre. Arômes dominants de houblon fruité, pêche, agrumes, ananas, mangue, cantaloup, et autre fruits tropicaux. On peut percevoir également des effluves rappelant davantage le conifère, ainsi que des notes plus maltées rappelant le pain frais derrière cet abondant houblon. Le nez est très agréable et bien intense, mais on ne peut pas dire quil soit très complexe cependant, il est presque tout en houblon. En bouche, le pétillement sur la langue est plutôt léger, mais cest dune rondeur et dune onctuosité merveilleuse, cest soyeux et légèrement huileux au palais. Au goût, il sagit véritablement dune invasion de houblon fruité (pêche, agrumes, fruits tropicaux) tandis que le malt prend des saveurs plus discrètes de pain frais avec un léger sucre dorge. Lamertume est plutôt élevée, mais elle est agréable et très bien intégrée au breuvage. Étonnamment, lalcool est tout à fait imperceptible malgré son 10,2%. Cest sûr que cest un peu unidimensionnel comme bière, mais il sagit dun excellent produit de dégustation! Quiconque désire savoir ce que goûte le houblon Citra devrait se procurer une Herbe à Détourne de Dieu du Ciel! [Note : On sen serait douté, mais je voulais le tester : cette bière ne vieillie pas bien! Après un an en cellier, les flaveurs de pain et de levure ont pris le dessus sur celles du houblon, et lagréable amertume devient dune désagréable âcreté. Cest significativement moins bon! Dommage que cette bière ne soit offerte quune fois par année]

Cette bière a beaucoup plus de points en commun avec la dernière IPA américaine que jai bu quavec lensemble des Tripel que jai dégustées dans ma vie... mais quand jaime, je pardonne tout. Bottle into Duvel Tulip.  Hazy orange color with 1 finger super foamy head.  Looks amazing.  As I pour the floral and citrus hop aroma fills the room.  The hops subside a bit and the aroma is full of yeast, sugar, medium malt, fantastic.   Opens sweet with some mildly high carbonation.  Then becomes yeasty, tangy, a bit of fruit I cant place, kiwi or something?  Finish is bitter, sweetness lingers, a little soapy.  This beer smells and looks amazing, the taste does not live up to that but still a damn fine beer.

Bottle shared by Dmac; thanks dude!pours out a somewhat cloudy orangey color with a small white head. Aroma is of light fruits, apricot, some light spices and yeast. Taste drops off a bit, odd vegetal notes, strange wilted flower, fruit, mild spices, some boozy sweetness.

11.2 oz bottle thanks to the one and only glouglouburp. Poured a hazy nectar orange with a smaller foamy bright white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, light sugar, honey, sweet dough. Good body with a fuller mouthfeel and softer carbonation with small bubbly carbonation. Flavor is a mixture of sweet sugar and dried out tropical fruits, some rind, bread crusts, Belgian yeast. Gets better with some warmth.

At Cask Beer Festival 2012 
Aroma fruity front, with citrus hop profile. Darker side behind. 7+
 Appearance   hazed amber gold with medium rocky top.
Flavor and Palate :  medium bodied. Fairly crisp up front despite delicate carbonation. Slight hint of green apple  , behind fruits and some alcohol.  Finish bitter. Nice.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2013 Cask Days 2013. Big bright nose and a lot of intense tropical fruit aroma. A bit chewy with some lovely sweet pale malt. A bit sweet bit the hoppiness does cut it. Lean pale malt and a nice spicy yeast   Fresh and a bit fruity. Pretty lovely brew.

Pale amber. Spicy/ fruity hop nose. A bit of sweet pepper and some earthiness.  A little bit of fruit. Very bitter for the style. Soft spice. Peppery. Decent if unusual. A sort of lingering mintiness. I like it.
8 4 7 4 15
This was delicious - on cask at Torontos Cask Days festival.  The hoppy aroma is inviting with citrus notes and then the yeasty and grassy notes hit from the triple and sweetness and bitter combine.

bottle provided by Paul .. . pours a deep gold .. light haze ..  medium head, pounded out like a mallard duck .. . touch of booze and lots of citra hops .. . quite an interesting beer .. . . the bartender on trying this beer "wow! that beer completely sliced through my triple latte!"

Huge thanks to Tommy for this bottle.  I adored this beer.  I dont like tripels generally but I loved this beer.  The citra hop adds a fresh tropical fruit profile and really balances the sweetness in such a big beer.  WOW great stuff.
Awesome triple. The citra and the yeast strain work and meld perfectly. Very drinkable

330ml brown bottle. Fromt he bottle the beer pours a glowing orange with fine haze. Fat and pillowy and creamy white cap which sits atop the brew for a very long time, very luscious.  Nose has honeyish notes, zesty orange. Taste has a honeyish start, zesty middle with orange peels, fades to slightly grapefruity territory, light grass, tace of spiciness, some alcohol in there. Pleasant mix of flavours overall, has the expected notes of a traditional tripel with some nice extra hopping, and a fantastic appearance.

341ml bottle, pours a slightly cloudy golden amber with a nice foamy head and lots of lace. Nice aroma of citrus and yeast, flavours of dried citrus fruit, sweet malts and some bready yeast. Noticeable alcohol - nice full body. Very nice beer.
UPDATED: MAY 22, 2015 Orange gold pour.  Sizeable white head.  Tropical fruit, nectarine,  honey, yeast, lemon zest in aroma and taste.  Yeasty, and the mouthfeel and carbonation are spot on.

En bouteille, servie dans un calice. Un beau blond doré opaque. Mousse blanche et crémeuse tenant bien. Au nez,  de puissantes notes dagrumes (citron, orange et pamplemousse) qui  masque légèrement un arôme de levure belge. En bouche, lentrée est très douce et fruitée; suivit de saveur marquée sur le palais qui laisse un agréable sensation en arrière bouche. Amertume tranchante et goût floral. Malgré son goût puissant, cette bière demeure très désaltérante. Une mixte intéressant entre une bière de style belge et le hyper-houblonnage de style américain.  Peut-être une des meilleures chez Dieu du ciel!

Bottle. Orange-gold, thick white head.My God Ive had some shit beers out at the lake this weekend, so I am really vibrating to try this.It smells amazing: lots of tropical fruit and spicy yeast. This is a dense palate of flavours: the fresh fruit is spectacular, and adds depth and character to what could otherwise be syrup sweetness-- lots of fresh pineapple, nectarine, guava, but its more than that.. The yeast is pillowy soft, yet the mouthfeel is heavy, and somehow the whole profile stays bright and balanced and dangerously drinable at 10+%.  Estery spice with white pepper dryness ending the parade of flavours before a surprisingly bitter finish ends it all off. I loved this beer. Im no true style judge, but this hit all the numbers for me in a way that a tripel hasnt in a long time.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Draft sample at THE FESTIVAL with Andrew. Dieu du ciel! was definitely one of the best overall tables at the event. Pours a hazy golden orange amber body with nice carbonated head. Aroma is sweet Belgian yeast, citrus fruit, fresh citrus hops, resin and pine. Mouthfeel is full and refreshing with notes of fresh citrus, pineapple, passion fruit, citrus hops and Belgian yeast. Im really not a huge fan of abbey triples but the American pale fresh and zesty aspect of this guy really made it unique. Additionally, +10% abv? Wow.

This thing is a work of art!  Pours a beautiful cloudy golden with a nice big frothy white top.  Aroma of big citrus, yeast, bread and passion fruit.  Taste is a great dry citrus hop bitter snap on the palate, softened with the sweet passion fruit and finally backed by the soft yeast bready notes.  I need to find more of this.

Passion fruit, citrus hops and a slight resin aroma open things up.  Amber orange hazy liquid that add a nice head for the first 5 minute. 
Sweet, long palate with well presented hops. Perfect Belgian yeast American Pale Ale ! Wait, its a Belgian Tripel.... 10,2% ?? No way. 
Great beer, great idea, ugly label.
A solid 4.1/5.

Ok amber lightly cloudy after the swirl. I plan on chugging this like it really matters. Quickly: mellow belg qualities with the spice etc and the oh-so-obvious citra dose to treat and confuse the nose. Fruity yeast spice and alcohol, peaches- decent. Whoa - Danny Garcia just layed the beats own to Khan - awesome!!! Pretty nice taste - mellow to a point and, yea, starting to love this more and more - growing on me like a soft mold. I wish this was a bigger bottle.... or just another bottle. So smooth with the faint spice until the end where the bitterness piles on a bit but not too much. This is a well put together beer. Sharp tasty grapefruit and peaches, almost chewy. Has a long bitter hardness that rolls on. Nice.

Cloudy beige with a big, rocky head.  The aroma is flowery, almost to the point of being perfumey, with light yuzu and phenolic, spicy yeast character.  Sweetish up front but then yeastiness and dryness start to take over.  Nice brew, and the assertive hopping keeps the sweetish elements of the tripel from overwhelming..
On tap at The Festival in Worcester, session 1. This beer was awesome. Juicy and tropical fruit gives way to doughy spice. So quenching and delicious- making it quite dangerous.

12 oz. bottle, pours a cloudy semi-dark orange with a small white head. Nose is quite hoppy for a tripel, with floral hops, some Belgian spices, dough, biscuit and citrus. Flavour of honey sweetness above anything, apricots, citrus fruits, biscuit, and flowers. Finishes semi-sweet and on the flowers note, with a slight lingering bitterness. Unorthodox tripel, with some unusual notes. Enjoyable.

[4426-20120518] 341mL bottle. Sweaty orange hops aroma. Clear, dark orange brown body with a quick foamy white head. Sweaty bitter orange lemon zest flavour. Medium-full body. Tasty but a little odd. (7/4-/8/4/16) 3.9
Overheard: "Leighton gets touched by light and hes done." "Hes the worst vampire ever."

Bottle... Mostly-clear golden ale with a small, creamy, white head. Fantastic retention. The nose furnishes tropical fruit, apricot, and musky, peppery notes. Medium-bodied with a lightly creamy mouthfeel and tingly carbonation. The flavor is a merger of hopped-up bitterness, and biscuit and honey sweetness. Crisp, bittersweet finish... the bitterness lingers a good while.

Typical Citra hop noze with full grapefruit aroma and a touch of lemon. Cloudy golden color with small head. Explosion of tropical fruits like mango, melon and grapefruit. Complexity of flavors is remarquable. A perfect mix of bitterness and flavors. A real delight for palate. De la grande bière!!!

Golden orange pour with small off white head. Aroma of malts, fruity, grapefruit and hops. Taste of honey, ripe fruit, grapefruit and orange peel. Confused about this being classified a triple as this is clearly a DIPA. Not Diue du Ciels  best effort from this great brewery.
very good, on tap at WVRST. Really hoppy and drinkable, the combination makes for a strong contender as a great Belgian IPA.  Funky aroma.  Orange colour. Thick lace sheet.Above average mouthfeel.

Taster at Balthazar. Blond/hay, quickly fading white head, quite hazy. Aroma is really somewhere between citrus, grass and ammonia (!). Not sure if the latter is good. Taste is pretty .... actually surprisingly straightforward, when considering the rest : there is honey, raisins, hay and fruit esters.... pretty much everything for everyone, not just sure if everything blends that well. The key here is the palate -- it would seem like the finish hits really early (... and extremely dry), but then the post-finish (!!!) hits with some really subtle, but extremely pleasant cherry notes. All in all -- nor for anyone, and a bit of a letdown considering its DDC, but still a rather good and very complex brew.
Aroma: cat pee (surprisingly), spruce, very complex. Taste: very bitter, grapefruit. Palate: destruction!! Drink it last, because the aroma and the taste are very intense!

Pours a slightly syrupy, lightly carbonated clear amber with thin but lingering head.  Huge aroma of tropical fruits as soon as the bottle opens.  Touch of citrus.  In the mouth it skews more towards the malts, which are quite sweet.  Mouthfeel is rich and syrupy.  Warming alcohol.  Bitter finish.  Well balanced.  Dont really get the belgian character much, it comes across as a DIPA or big american barley wine.

341 ml bottle from Broue Ha Ha, served cool in a tulip glass. 05MA12.
App.:  Clear very deep golden with a fair light tan-yellowish head.
  
Aroma:  Strong, boozy, thick, lemony, zesty, citrus, resinous, sweet honey, floral notes, big, evergreen/pine/resin, bright, some esters, wow.
  
Palate:  Medium+ body, full effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Peppery, spicy, sweet, dank and resinous, lemony, boozy, thick and rich, huge, honey and floral notes, so persistent, peppery, etc.; sweet, boozy, fairly bitter, fruity, wow again.

A huge and quite hoppy Tripel.  My kinda beer!

One of my favourite beer. Aroma of fruits and hops. When you look at it, the color is orange  and hazy. A taste divine, fruity and bitter. It is a really beautiful experience in the palate. A must taste!

Bottle. Cloudy or very hazy dark amber with a growing layer of foam. Strong hop aroma with lots of citrus some nice malt backing and alcohol note. The scent makes me think of a spiked orange cocktail. Big hop presence in the mouth and a big funky yeast taste that ties back into the nose.  A bit dirty and American for the style but tasty.

Brumeux, robe jaune orange, mousse parfaitement crémeuse.  Forte odeur dagrume.  Goût riche, amertume tranchante qui domine, sucre en arrière plan, un peu terreux.  Chaud et rond en bouche.  Très bone bière, seul critique; larrière goût est pas très bon.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2012 Hazy dark orange colour with a lively carbonation. Great aroma, has all those belgian yeast fruity esters but is also has a  tropical citrus note amplified by the hops. The palate is rich and warming like a tripel should be but the hops adds a certain depth of character and a leafy/bitter & juicy goodness to the brew. delicious!! one of my favs.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2012 341ml bottle. Amber/organge pour with almost white head that leaves a little lace. Smells like a spruce farm with underlying hints of fruit and Belgian yeast. Lots more fruit on the palate with some spruce and yeast. Finishes with a good long bitterness that has a lot of fruit and a little heat.

2012-05-19. Dark orange amber body with a small beige head. 3+ interesting aroma,  leafy herbaceous hops, light malt, muted sweet citrus. 7+ Flavour is quite nice, leafy citrusy, mild alcohol, mild sweetish malt core. 7++ Smooth average plus to medium bodied palate. 3+ Dangerously drinkable, pleasantly hoppy. Quite nice. More please. Bottle shared by DuctTape 16

Single bottle purchased from Zyn Liqour in Calgary, AB on 05/11/2012. Colour: Light orange/dark yellow combo, with medium-high soft white foam. Nose: Herbal introduction which graduates to sweet fruit of berries and melon. Traces of flowers dance in the background. The malt plays sweet here. Medium-high sweet, medium bitter. medium-light sour. Plenty of sweetness to go around, which I presume is present to dull down the 10.2 abv a bit, no? The hops are grapefruit-esqu and mid to late palate displays a basket of herbs and spices. They linger long into the finish. Decent.

341ml bottle pours a slightly hazy golden orange color with a 2 finger white head that leaves some nice lacing on the glass.  Aromas are dominated by citrus with some faint yeast notes and light fruits.  Taste is malty sweet with some light citrus and fruits and hints of yeast.  Has a dry finish.  Medium bodies with modest carbonation leaving a nice mouthfeel.  A nice representation of a Belgian style tripel and highly recommended.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2016 Updated rating last reviewed in 2012. A: mango, tropical, peaches App: hazy pale with small white head t/p: med body with medium long bitter finish. Moderate carbonation. O: what a beer Im really glad to find out that this beer will be offered for a longer period. Its super fruity, true hop juice.

Bière blonde dorée dapparence trouble ayant une belle tête mousseuse. Des odeurs assez prononcées de houblon, dagrumes, dherbes variées et dépices. Goût assez rentre-dedans. Cest amer, résineux, huileux et ça ne laisse pas de place à autre chose à part lalcool, qui lui, semble rouler en Hummer dans une ruelle. Larrière-goût est tapissé par lamertume. Pas très subtil. (225-010512)

Bottle - 341ml. Beautiful hazy amber body with an average, lasting white foamy/creamy head. Its fresh hoppy aroma carries strong melon hints. Alcohol is very well hidden. Sharp, well balanced hoppy taste with malty, melon, and some piney notes. Ends with a long, robust, moderately warming bitter finish. Very nice!

Beautiful finger of yellowish off whtie head and big lacing rings. Clear body with a colour of pale golden with bright orange hints in the body. Medium carbonation in the body. Looks like an IPA. Big hop aroma with huge resin and citrus fruit notes. Massively resinous and zesty citrus hops. Nose has some mild esters and a sweet yeast aroma. The taste has grapefruit, lemon, potent hop with a lingering bitterness and dryness on the finish. Dont notice the alcohol at all, but light Belgian yeast flavor and fruity apple and pears. Light spice and no malts at all. This drinks like an Imperial IPA, not a tripel.

Bottle at home, from my lovely Minneapolis Town Hall glass. Pours cloudy golden/deep honey gold, thick white head, poor lacing. Nose is spicy hops, clean malt, typical "Tripel" yeast note, some spun sugar, some candy floss, some ginger. Flavours of soapy Tripel yeast, some spicy Citra hop notes are identifiable, very creamy throughout, lots of soap too...  Honestly about what I expected with a top-notch brewery doing a dry-hopped Tripel, but perhaps just a shade too estery for my tastes.

341 ml bottle. Pours an orange golden with a persistent white head. Smells fruity and sweet. Tastes like oranges, yeast, sweet bread and tropical fruits. Good, very lemon- and citrus-flavored bitterness in the finish. A bit of acidity, and warm alcohol feel too. Medium-bodied. Excellent ale, loved it.

Bottle 341 ml. Pours orange-amber with a little non lasting white head and some lacing. Aroma: Citra hops, sweet fruits (mango, tropical fruits), citrus and spices. Great taste, very bitter (maybe a  little too much) and hoppy. Alcohol taste is well hidden, despite the fact that this is a 10,2%. Full bodied. Very ejoyable.
Bouteille 341 ml. Robe orange-ambrée, leger collet blanc non persistant et "lacing". Arome: Houblon Citra, fruits sucrés (mangue, fruits tropicaux), agrumes et épices. Bon goût, très amer (peut-être un peu trop) et houbloné. Lalcool est bien masqué pour une bière à 10,2%. Ronde à bouche. Très agréable.

Style et résumé: Triple moderne au citra. 
Comment: Bouteille de 341ml achetée chez Peluso. 
Description: Bière blonde dorée avec une mousse blanche durable. Le nez dagrume, citra, fort agréable. Jaime le nez. La bouche est puissante, lalcool trop présent, ce qui rend la bière chaude, longue et quelque peu dérangeant en fin de bouche. La texture est huileuse. Est-ce que la version en fût serait meilleure? 
Note:  6 /10

Bottle 341 ml. Pours dark golden with a little white foam. Nose of citrus (mango), hops and pine. Slight alcohol. Taste is hops and loads of fruitiness. Slight notes of spices and herbal/floral.  Warming alcohol and medium-long hoppy aftertaste. Palate is almost creamy. Overall its a very nice beer. An hybrid between an Abbey Tripel and a smooth Double IPA. Refreshing and drinkable but also damn strong (10,2% abv). Good complexity and very nice balance.

341 Ml, cuvée 2012, Nez de fruit et de houblon, couleure dorée et col qui se dissipe pour laissé une petite épaisseure de mousse. En bouche, des notes de fruit sucrés et mangues, qui laisse place rapidement à des saveurs de pamplemousse et dune très agrable amertume qui perdure. Chaque gorgé est magique! Jen tomberai volontairement dans la cuve comme Obélix.

Cloudy amber with a minimal white head. Aroma is tropical fruits with herbal notes. Medium body with soft carbonation. In mouth its herbal, fruity, earthy and slightly bitter. Long lasting aftertaste.

(341 ml)  Une belle robe dorée qui se présente avec un simple anneau de mousse.  Des arômes qui offrent un spectacle fruité assez intense.  Des fruits jaunes sous les tropiques.  Des fleurs comme un parfum féminin et sensuel.  Un alcool complété par de douces céréales maltées.  Un goût puissant et cérébral.  Une levure et du Citra: une combinaison alléchante.  Un territoire fruité.  Un alcool chaud et costaud.  Un amoncellement de notes florales.  Des malts sucrés qui sétalent avec une intelligence certaine.  Un corps bien rond avec sa douce effervescence.  Une texture huileuse.  Une finale parfumée, amère et probablement trop chaude.

Tap. Moderate malt aromas of light bread and grain, perfume and pine for the hops, light dough and soap for the yeast, with peach, white wine, honey and alcohol. Head is average size, frothy, white with excellent lacing and is fully lasting. color is hazy amber. Flavor starts immoderately sweet and lightly to moderately sweet, then finishes lightly sweet and acidic with a long moderate bitter note, Head is on the fuller of medium, a little slick with a carbonation between soft and lively, and finishes moderately to heavily alcoholic and fairly dry. A very nice Abbey Tripel, full of fruity aromas and flavors, but there is a big alcohol presence behind it all

Pours golden, with white head, some lacing. Aroma is of citrus (grapefruits), sweet fruits, malt. Taste is of grapefruits, some sweetness, malt. Very bitter, and so is the finish. Alchool well hidden. Massive hopping. Well balanced anyways. Full bodied.

Verse une bière dorée troublée. Mousse blanche, éphémère. Au nez, un délicieux arôme de houblon, dagrumes, pamplemousse, pêche, fraises. En bouche, la bulle se fait légère avec une pointe damertume en finale. Domination de fruits, cantaloup et mangue. Une excellente bière!

Had on tap at the Montreal Dieu du Ciel... Fresh hop aroma mix with a powerful herbaceous undertone.... Wow a very interesting Belgian triple with a high ABV notes of citrus, sage, thyme rosemary and savory brighten up this beer to make it a highlight of the 17 beers they had on tap !

Tap at Winter Warmer: Poured a cloudy dirty beige color ale with a large foamy head. Aroma of pungent hops and semi-sweet Belgian-style malt is quite interesting. Taste is a nice mix between some pungent herbal hops with nice floral notes which are well balanced against some semi-sweet Belgian-style malt with light residual sugar notes. Body was quite full with limited filtration and good carbonation with no apparent alcohol. This was quite a treat and something I would buy often if it was to be bottled.

Mmmm hops citra aroma some sweet grapefruit pine and some other fruits, deeeeelicious
