Winter warmer 2012.  Offerte en remplacement de leur bière sûre aux griottes.  Belle bière voilée, couleur de miel, coiffée dun fin col traçant le verre délicatement.  Des arômes herbacés de conifères et dagrumes avec une note de savon très intéressante!  Amertume dimpact.  De corps solide, elle est veloutée et finement effervescente.  Longue fin amère et aromatique.  Superbe bière!
À lhivernale des brasseurs de Montréal: Léger, poivré avec le citra qui sexprime librement. Très rafraîchissant avec quand même une belle complexité.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2012 Bouteille 341 ml. En fût chez DDC à St-Jérôme. 10.2%. Couleur ambrée, claire, mousse blanche. Arôme de résine, malt, un peu de fruit, mangue. En bouche, houblon Citra, citrus, malt, herbes, céréales et un peu dalcool qui est très, très bien dissimulée. Finale très douce, un peu dalcool qui réchauffe, légère amertume. Du bonbon. Triple IPA.

Glass, 5 ounces, during the 2011 Festibière de Québec, savoured on September 2 2011; eye:  copper, clear, no effervescence, tiny ring of kaki head; nose: resinous hops, grapefruit, malt, alcohol, light orange; mouth: resinous hops, grapefruit, malt, alcohol, light orange, alcohol warmth, finale in hops with good presence of malt and alcohol, full body, good carbonation, rather bitter, mildly sweet, lightly alcoholic texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS 

Verre, 5 onces, durant le Bières et saveurs de Chambly, savourée le 2 septembre 2011; il : cuivrée, limpide, pas deffervescence, petit anneau de mousse kaki; nez : houblon résineux, pamplemousse, malt, alcool, léger orange; bouche : houblon résineux, pamplemousse, malt, alcool, léger orange, chaleur dalcool, finale en houblon avec bonne présence de malt et dalcool, corsée, bonne carbonatation, plutôt amère, moyennement sucrée, texture légèrement alcoolique; en résumé : bien

on tap at brewpub. bright golden, decent white head, little retention/lacing. loads of citrus, citra in water, strawberry. some caramel maltiness. taste is maltied-pepper, citra, faint belgiumness. soft carbonation, light to medium body, long citrusy finish.

On tap at Dieu du Ciel. Poured a hazy yellow color with a small sized white head. Aromas of citrus, pine, yeast, and fruity. Tastes of citrus, fruits, spices, pine, and yeast. Nice hoppy finish. Overall alcohol well hidden.

On tap at Fieu du ciel.The color is a hazy honey with a thin beige head. The aroma is of hops and citrus fruits. The taste also of different kinds of hops,pink grapefruit,abit of mint and yeast.This tasted alot like a strong I.P.A. nothing bad about that.It would be very good on a hot summer day.

On tap at the Dieu du Ciel brewpub in Montréal, served in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a moderate, dense white head. The head fades slowly to a bare cover, leaving a moderate amount of fine lace. The aroma has huge citrus notes along with pine, flowers and biscuit malt. The flavour is quite bitter up front and becomes more so with strong grapefruit notes, herbs, some pepper and alcohol. There is also a hint of dry biscuit malts. The finish is long, lingering citrus. On the palate, it is medium in body with a dry, slightly acidic texture and average carbonation. Overall, this is a very nice citrusy tripel. It is very fresh with beautiful hops, but the malts are somewhat neglected. Overall it is well put together but I wonder if it could use a different yeast, something with a bit more Belgian character. 2011-02-02

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2013 On tap at the Blind Tiger.  Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head.  Big pine, resinous and sweet.  Toast, sweet malt and candy sugar.  Big earthy hops.  Long earthy toast and some warm alcohol (but very faint) on the finish.

On tap at Dieu du Ciel.  Pours a lightly hazed gold with a medium sized white head.  Huge citrus on the nose, big and bright.  Medium bodied, then the alcohol shows up, big and heavy, but while warm and boozy this isnt so big that its unbearable.  Though I am glad I went with a smaller pour.  Chewy with a load of citrus musk and warmth into the finish.  Beautiful.  Big though.  But damned beautiful.

Tap at BT.  Pours a slight hazed deep golden peachy color with a medium white head- mostly lasting- some sticky lace.  Aroma is citra hops- grapefruit, tangerine, citrus, then some pine and light catty notes- then light doughy toasted malts, light phenolic belgian yeast tries to clash with the hops- gives slight soapiness.  Flavor is light soap, lemon lime, citra, grapefruit, catpiss, pine, resin light sappy, more phenolics- then a mostly dry finish (after some mid palate sugary sweetness), then a similar ddc drying papery tacky finish which dries out my mouth a bit too much- strange feeling, but not bad.  Overall, pretty interesting, -I liked it.

In short: An intense and aggressive Abbey Triple that tastes more like an uber-hoppy Citra IIPA (with unfortunate cat piss side-effect)
How: Tap at brewpub
The look: Almost clear dark blonde body topped by a long-lasting small white head leaving lots of lacings
In long: Strong nose of citra hops.  When used more moderately citra hops has a nice floral and tropical fruits signature.  But here it is overwhelming and to me smells like condensed tulips juice, freshly cut apricots and cat piss.  Too much Citra does that to me, cat piss sensation.  Taste is intense.  Lots of apricots, pineapples, flowers, grass and passion fruits with an abrasive flowery bitterness that also has a light cat piss flavor.  Bitterness is very sharp and aggressive.  The Belgian nature of the beer is buried under a mountain of citra hops.  Tastes more like an uber-hoppy citra American IPA than an Abbey Triple.  It seems that I like this beer less than most people.  Something about me noticing a light cat piss aroma & flavor that nobody else seems to get.  And Im not sure what disturbs me the most here.  Finding a cat piss flavor in a beer or thinking I know what cat piss tastes like?

@Mondial de la Bière 2010, Strasbourg - pours a dark golden beer with a little white foam left; intense citrusy and piney hops in the aroma; full-bodied, a fair carbonation and a solid bitterness; long fruity hoppy finish (blood oranges and citrus) with lingering warming alcohol notes - a beautiful beer again from DDC

Bottle 33 @ mondial de la bière. An amber beer with medium head. Smell is heavy on hops and yeast. This beer is very sweet, syrupy, and resine like, a good beer but alcohol is very present. Fruity it is near vine like muscat. Good with an impressive hops at the finish.

Slight hazy honey gold hue, with a white head, nice aromatic floral citra hop nose with some fruity esters of apricot, lychee, rambutan, pineapple, orange peel, and pear, with some light piney, resinous, cedary, accents, with a faint menthol cloverleaf mintiness, anda yeasty citrusy aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with nice belgian yeast, fruity, light honeyed pale, toasted malt, intense herbal grassy flowery  citra hop, leafy character with some fruity, yeasty lemon, lime peel, pineapple, pear, lychee notes, and a faint spicy fresh minty menthol leafiness, leading towards a fruity, leafy, grassy, cedary hop bitterness finish.

On tap at DDC this past June.  An interesting one, this.  I dont get a lot of peach in the nose; its more nectarine or tangerine or somethingerine.  Smells good, though.  Some herbs and yeast in there as well.  Theres more peach and citrus in the flavour.  Its quite juicy, although dryish.  Booze, yeast and malt as well.  I like it!

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2011 12oz on tap at brewery.
Appearance : Clear pale amber with small foamy head. Not much lacing.

Aroma : Great floral notes with light cat piss notes.Citrusy and leafy. Light honey.

Taste : Crisp citrusy hops with light yeast. Finish is quite bitter, a bit astringent even. Light malty notes.

Overall : Nice crisp hops. Powerful aroma. Quite refreshing but a bit too astringent for my taste. Maybe not as good as what I remember the first batch tasting like. Rating stays the same.

On tap at DDC anniversary.
Appearance : Clear amber with a small head. Light lacing.

Aroma : Greatly citrusy and leafy. Nice hops. Notes of citrus fruits. Yeasty and malty.

Taste : Citrusy and leafy with some sugar. Passion fruits and leafy hops on the finish. A bit resinous and bitter also. Some yeast.

Overall : Nice leafy and citrusy profile. Nice sugar also. Very interesting beer. Too bad I had it late on the evening. I will need to revisit this one. 101001 8,9,7,9,16;3.7

Huge aroma of citrus fruit, peaches, and plums! wow! the flavor is laced with hoppy goodness. lots of fruit, and a nice peppery spiciness from the hops mixed with the alcohol. Some subtle grains, and some malt just to balance things out. wow, this was a great tripel.

Draught at Dieu du Ciel. Pours a clear gold with a small diminishing creamy white head. Amazing aroma of peach and grapefruit, switching back and forth, along with herbal notes, lots of hops, some yeast and mango -- I love it! Lovely flavour of Belgian yeast, lots of citrus and herbal hops, peach, mango and some alcohol, but nowhere near the 10% abv. Full bodied. An amazing beer.

Tap at brewpub.  Very harsh hoppiness, leaving any other flavors in the back.  Very citric and bitter, still quite easy to drink.  Alchool also clouded by that aggressive citra hop.  Very nice aroma of lemon and flowers.  Overall fine but there was something a little awkward...

Verre de 12 oz, à la brasserie de Montréal. Arômes de houblon très citronné et légèrement herbacé. On retrouve également une touche de levure. Robe blonde pâle, légèrement trouble, belle petite mousse et effervescence moyenne. En bouche, la bière présente une belle texture veloutée. Bien que présente, la levure légèrement fruitée demeure en retrait. Le malt, délicatement sucré et bien rond supporte bien le houblon, très fruité et citronné. Finale moyennement amère et alcoolisée. Lalcool est dailleurs un peu trop apparent en finale.

Sampled at the 2010 VT Brewers Fest - Poured a golden amber in color with a small bright white head.  Aroma is a heady combination of bready Belgian yeasts and citrusy hops.  Flavor pretty much follow suit, but with plenty of fruit flavors too.  A Citra-hopped tripel... simply awesome...

On tap at Vermont Brewfest 2010. Light golden pour with a big fluffy head. Aroma is packed with citrus hops, herbs, yeast, a touch of peach, and some floral presence as well. Flavor continues the trend, with lemon and orange rind, herbal notes, dough, and wheat grain. Palate is remarkably smooth and clean, particularly for a 10% beer. Very good stuff.

On tap at the mondial de la biere 2010...
Aroma:Grapefruit and citrus hops...
Appearance:Clear gold,light head...
Flavor:Strong risinus hops,grapefruit and lemon...

On tap @ Mondial 2010.

    Aroma has citrus hops, some decent malt, golden small white head. Flavour has plenty of orange and lemon, a boat load of malt which ties together rather well. Full bodied, extremely well balanced, quite bitter, with a nice tongue tingle. Terrific! My 1000th Canadian Beer

A golden amber ale with a thin white head. A superb aroma of floral orangey hops, funky and sweaty, intense chamomille. In mouth, a rather stiking IPA with herbal pinhey hops, warming alcohol, sweaty blood orange, quite challenging. Rich and warming. On tap at Mondiale de la Bière 2010.

Pours a rich golden hue with a thin white head; yields nice spotty lacing around the glass.  Aroma is quite sharp, there are some prominent citrus notes with a piny undertone.  Carbonation is at a good level; nice and smooth on the palate.  The sharpness of the citrus along with the alcohol is right up front in the flavor, and it gives way to an aromatic piny and resinous hop profile in the finish.  Another enjoyable addition to the legendary Dieu du Ciel roster.

From tap @ mondial. Very pretty light gold pour with fluffy white head that leaves a ton of lacing and sticks around until the bottom of the glass. Solid aroma, lots of lemony hops and some pale malts, completely addicting aroma, cant get my nose out of the glass. Taste is a lemony as well, some good malty taste but a bit hot with alcohol. Palate is average for the style. A wow beer for me.

Verre de dégustation provenant dun fût dégusté au Mondial de la Bière 2010 (Montréal, QC). Arôme: Odeur de pin et de citron. Apparence: La couleur est dorée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de pin et de citron avec une pointe de céréales. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence dhoublons résineux en arrière goût. (Rating #3057)

Drank on day 1 of the 2010 Mondial de la Bière. Clear blonde, medium head. Aroma of semisweet hops, notes fragrant herbs. Taste of malted barley weel blended with the hops, notes of herbs and a little bitter. A very pleasant and well balanced tripel!

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2012 My Bottom Line:
This hybrid of a strong ale displays lots of citrusy fruitiness dallying atop and within biscuity pale malts, while spicy, herbal hop qualities grab on to every prickly bubble.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam tops the clear honey gold.
-Alcohol is very well hidden. This is actually very drinkable for its size.
-There are lots of pale malt flavors (on tap, not in the bottle) and relatively few dextrins (for a brew this size). Me likey.
-While the hop aroma is mostly citrusy, the flavors and finish develop intense spicy notes which are very compelling, and even passionfruit and durian angles (the good ones, dont worry).

Bottles, on tap at the brewpub and, initially, at the Mondial.

on tap at Dieu du Ciel. served in a tulip, this beer pours a dark copper with a thin white head. aroma is dominated by citrus, herbs and malts. taste is grapefruit, with lots of herbs. the alcohol is pretty well hidden. mouthfeel is sticky, and lots of carbonation. im not crazy about this one. wont be buying again.
Sampled at the Mondial de la bière 2010. Slightly hazy copper with a thin head. Arom is lemon, citrus, herbs, malt and alcohol. Flavor is herbs, malt, citrus, oily hops, bitterness and sweet malt.
